page.title: 13Churches,Stambourne, etc.
page.content: The Parish Churches of St.Peter & St. Thomas, Stambourne and St. Margaret of Antioch, Toppesfield are both served by the Rev.Jessup, who lives in the new Toppesfield Rectory. Toppesfield Church dates from the 14th century and is built of flint rubble and plaster. The brick tower was built in 1699 after the original tower collapsed. There is a musicians' gallery at the west end. Stambourne Church, which is also mainly flint, dates from about 1100, although it was largely rebuilt in the 16th century. The ancient med- ieval window is in a dangerous condit- ion and Â£15000 is needed to carry out urgent repairs.Normal congregations at each Church average 20_25 but monthly family services are being introduced which it is hoped will encourage more people to attend.Both Churches now have a Sunday School and also a choir.
